title: Best of friends! Courteney Cox enjoys cosy dinner date with Jennifer Aniston and Matt LeBlanc
text:
They played iconic pals Monica Geller, Rachel Green and Joey Tribbiani in the hit sitcom Friends.

And Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston and Matt Le Blanc proved they're close in real life too, with the trio posing for a photo at Courteney's home.

The stars were all clearly enjoying each other's company and beamed into the camera before Courteney posted the picture on Instagram.

Throwback! Courteney Cox, Jennifer Aniston and Matt Le Blanc met up for a Friends reunion as they posed for a photo at Courteney's home. Right: The stars during their time on the hit show

All three stars looked radiant, with Courteney's glowing hue complemented by her shining raven tresses.

Jennifer looked at home in her relaxed surroundings as she donned a pair of stylish glasses.

In a caption alongside the photo, Courteney wrote: 'A rare night and I love it.'

Mega hit: The stars acted alongside David Schwimmer (centre), who played Ross Geller; Matthew Perry (right), who played Chandler Bing and Lisa Cudrow, who played Phoebe Buffay

A good run: Friends aired for 11 seasons from 1994 and became enormously popular worldwide

The three stars acted on the show alongside Matthew Perry, who played Chandler Bing, David Schwimmer who played Ross Gellar and Lisa Kudrow, who played Phoebe Buffay.

It aired for 11 seasons from 1994 and became enormously popular worldwide.

The cast have enjoyed numerous reunions since the final episode in 2004, with all six stars remaining close.

Earlier in the summer, Courteney, Jennifer and Lisa posed for photo on Cox's 55th birthday.

In an Instagram post, she wrote: 'How lucky am I to celebrate my birthday with these two??? I love you girls. So much [HEART EMOJI].'

Radiant: Earlier in the summer, Courteney, Jennifer and Lisa posed for photo on Cox's 55th birthday

Goofing around: Lisa and Courteney had a bit of fun with filters for the former's Instagram

Matt recently confessed that although he would enjoy a reunion with his cast mates he feared he was too old now to reprise his Friends role.

'I understand that people really want to see that reunion,' he told 973FM's Bianca, Terry And Bob Show, based in Brisbane, Australia, last February.

'But that show was about a finite period in these six characters' lives, between 20 and 30.'

While Friends has been off the air for nearly 15 years, it made headlines in December when it was reported that Netflix had shelled out $100 million to keep the sitcom on the streaming service.

It had been paying $30 million a year to WarnerMedia since 2015 for the show, but when fans noticed it was set to leave on January 1, Netflix responded.
